ModuleInstance.ModuleInstanceDescription: <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Calibri, " segoe="" ui",="" calibri,="" thonburi,="" arial,="" verdana,="" sans-serif,="" "mongolian="" baiti",="" "microsoft="" yi="" "javanese="" text";="" font-size:="" 13.3333px;="" white-space:="" pre-wrap;"="">This MA level module is aimed at Media and Cultural Studies students who are interested in studying digital games, player cultures and games-making. The module combines face-to-face teaching with workshops, game play, practical sessions and online tasks. In part one of the module, students are introduced to game studies literature on rules, narrative, role, genre and navigation, and methods of game analysis.  In part two, the module focuses on player studies, to cover topics such as identity and learning within player communities.  In part 3, students have an opportunity to design games, make games, and further explore relevant research. Assessment is in two parts. Part 1 of the assignment is a ‘games diary’. For Part 2 of the assignment, students choose between (a) an essay on games or player cultures, or (b) game design work with an accompanying critical commentary.
ModuleInstance.ModuleInstanceRestriction: This module is only available to students on MA Digital Media: Critical Studies. It is expected to be a full class and therefore not available to students outside of the programme. It may be possible that some students from the other MA Digital Media routes can take this module if places become available.
